candidates.title: fix-ci: update to tokio 1.44.2 to fix RUSTSEC-2025-0023

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

candidates.body:
### Related

<!--
Include links to any related issues/PRs in a bulleted list, for example:
* Closes #1234
* Part of #1337
-->

### What

Fixes the cargo-deny workflow

```
 error[unsound]: Broadcast channel calls clone in parallel, but does not require `Sync`
    ┌─ /home/runner/work/rerun/rerun/Cargo.lock:686:1
    │
686 │ tokio 1.44.1 registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index
    │ ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ unsound advisory detected
    │
    ├ ID: RUSTSEC-2025-0023
    ├ Advisory: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2025-0023
    ├ The broadcast channel internally calls `clone` on the stored value when
      receiving it, and only requires `T:Send`. This means that using the broadcast
      channel with values that are `Send` but not `Sync` can trigger unsoundness if
      the `clone` implementation makes use of the value being `!Sync`.
```

candidates.title: Display thumbnail in tables by generating content-based hash for `Blob` components

labels.name: ui
labels.description: concerns graphical user interface

candidates.body: # What This PR enables thumbnail rendering in tables (dataframe view, redap browser, table entries) by "faking" a `RowId` based on the hash of the data. Also, move the thumbnail in front of the metadata label, so that the thumbnails are aligned in a table. **IMPORTANT** - ~This has a non-negligible performance impact on the frame time even when few visible rows, e.g. +1-2ms with only 37 row displayed.~ (Not so much by hashing a reasonable amount.) - It also makes the table noticeably more sluggish to scroll the first time (as the images get cached). - Because of how the row id is computed, there isn't a chance to share the cache of the same images, should they be displayed in some other view. Possible follow-up item (might actually be relatively easy): - https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/issues/9501 ### Before ### After # Performance Test setup: - Relese build - OPF example - Dataframe view with just the image archetype - 40 visible rows ### Baseline https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1cee3dd4-0f81-4ab8-916c-b6c96f0d436d ### After Main observation: CPU frame time increase due to content hashing remains low.

candidates.title: Support `#datapath` fragment on redap URL

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

labels.name: dataplatform
labels.description: Rerun Data Platform integration

candidates.body:
This adds support for appending a data path (e.g. `/some/entity[#42]`) to a redap URL, as a `#fragment`.

When clicking a redap URI with such a fragment, we will focus on that entity.
This is untested, however, and depends on us keeping the focus until the entity is loaded.

A `DataPath` is currently defined as

```rs
pub struct DataPath {
    pub entity_path: EntityPath,
    pub instance: Option<Instance>,
    pub component_name: Option<ComponentName>,
}
```

We will wanna extend this in the future to support tagging, and maybe even a timepoint.

### Extending it with time point

It's not clear how to specify _both_ time _and_ a data path in the fragment 🤔  I guess we need to use a special character, like comma:

`#/entity/path,log_tick=42` maybe

…and then comes the trouble of escaping

candidates.title: Fix 2D image split heuristic

labels.name: 🦟 regression
labels.description: A thing that used to work in an earlier release

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

labels.name: heuristics
labels.description: Heuristics for placing views, fallback provider, etc.

candidates.body:
### Related

* Fixes https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/issues/9363
* Regression caused by https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/pull/9308

### What

As far as I can tell the main breakage occurred because previously we tracked which visualizable entities remain in the subtree during image split computation. That's fixed by stopping image split detection when there's no images anymore (duh! ;-)). There was another issue where we'd count videos and encoded images both as each other additionally.

Adds a simple snapshot test for the spawn heuristic which was confirmed catching this! First of its kind 😱

candidates.title: Add `TableStore` for table/dataframe entries + basic UI

labels.name: ui
labels.description: concerns graphical user interface

labels.name: feat-dataframe-view
labels.description: Everything related to the dataframe view

candidates.body: ### Related * Part of: #8593 * Will unlock: #7204 ### What This brings a very basic table entry to the Rerun viewer. Tables are essentially dataframes, can contain Rerun-native components, but don't have to adhere to some of the restrictions that we place on regular entities (i.e. we don't require indexation columns). ### Testing The following will create a _very_ basic table in-memory. A follow-up PR will add GRPC-based sending of dataframes. ``` RERUN_EXPERIMENTAL_TABLE=1 pixi run rerun ``` ### Known issues * [x] Deleting all recordings switches to welcome screen although tables still present. (tracked via #9465) * [x] Finding the closest entry after closing is not implemented (will be closed via #9464)

candidates.title: Introduce URI scheme for dataset and add support for opening remote recordings using the new API

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

labels.name: dataplatform
labels.description: Rerun Data Platform integration

candidates.body:
Introduce the URL scheme for downloading dataset data:

```
$ORIGIN/dataset/$DATASET_ID/data?partition_id=$PARTITION_ID[&time_range=$TIME_RANGE]
```

Relevant slack thread for the backing discussion: https://rerunio.slack.com/archives/C08EWSCS26P/p1743092658188489

For now, we only support fetching a single partition, so the `partition_id` parameter is mandatory. In the future, we will support arbitrary queries.  The `time_range` parameter is optional. If used, the time range will be highlighted, but filtering on actual time range when fetching chunk is not yet supported (https://github.com/rerun-io/dataplatform/issues/474).

NOTES:
- Review commit-by-commit. The first commit is a pure move refactor.
- I've updated the existing `Recording` tests instead of adding new ones, because this stuff will soon be removed anyways.

candidates.title: Unify redap browser and recording panel

labels.name: ui
labels.description: concerns graphical user interface

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

candidates.body: ### Related * Closes https://github.com/rerun-io/dataplatform/issues/396 * Closes https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/issues/9336 ### What After the initial implementation wasn't as nice to use as we hoped (the recording panel ui changing when clicking a dataset was disorienting) I've re-done the PR with a more unified implemenation where the redap browser is integrated in the recording panel. - redap servers / datasets are now always shown in the recording panel, and open recodings are listed in each dataset - state of open dataset/server is now stored via DisplayMode - add new Item::RedapEntry and Item::RedapServer - don't add a feature flag but instead show a warning in add server modal - removes server/local tab - if a server was added, the left panel will be shown when rerun starts https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/087e3ffa-6dbe-499a-86a6-c5c4da6f2c9f

chosen_pr.title: fix-ci: update to tokio 1.44.2 to fix RUSTSEC-2025-0023

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

chosen_pr.body:
### Related

<!--
Include links to any related issues/PRs in a bulleted list, for example:
* Closes #1234
* Part of #1337
-->

### What

Fixes the cargo-deny workflow

```
 error[unsound]: Broadcast channel calls clone in parallel, but does not require `Sync`
    ┌─ /home/runner/work/rerun/rerun/Cargo.lock:686:1
    │
686 │ tokio 1.44.1 registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index
    │ ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ unsound advisory detected
    │
    ├ ID: RUSTSEC-2025-0023
    ├ Advisory: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2025-0023
    ├ The broadcast channel internally calls `clone` on the stored value when
      receiving it, and only requires `T:Send`. This means that using the broadcast
      channel with values that are `Send` but not `Sync` can trigger unsoundness if
      the `clone` implementation makes use of the value being `!Sync`.
```

```
      channel with values that are `Send` but not `Sync` can trigger unsoundness if
      the `clone` implementation makes use of the value being `!Sync`.
```
